priorVersion.title: CDISC SDTM Vaccines Findings About Test Code Terminology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C142187

self.title: CDISC SDTM Vaccines Findings About Test Code Terminology

definition: Terminology relevant to the test codes that describe findings about a vaccines event or intervention.
name: Vaccines Findings About Test Code
preferredTerm: CDISC SDTM Vaccines Findings About Test Code Terminology

terms.definition: The outward or visible aspect of an entity.
Description of the distribution pattern of a finding within the examined area.
The total number of episodes that have occurred for the condition.
The circumferential measurement of an entity or object of interest at its widest point.
terms.preferredTerm: Greatest Circumference at Point of Interest
synonyms: Greatest Circ at Point of Interest
Greatest Circumference at Point of Interest
Largest Circumference at Point of Interest

terms.definition: The longest possible length of a straight line passing through the center of a circular or spheroid object that connects two points on the circumference.
A number representing the outer diameter of a needle. (NCI)
The anatomical joint in closest proximity to the entity or object of interest.
An indication as to whether something has happened, such as an event or incident.
An indication as to whether the event or intervention prevents or has prevented the performance of daily activities.
An indicator as to whether the subject has symptoms of itchiness.
A standardized categorical classification of the severity of an event or finding.
